result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene A. Elgersma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gene A. Elgersma

records.addlTxt:
2:32 PM Defendant Gene A. Elgersma in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Gene A. Elgersma. Plea agreement, charges, and penalties reviewed. Def enters a plea of no contest; Court makes findings, accepts plea, and enters conviction. Sentencing arguments heard; def makes a statement.
Court imposes the following sentence:
$100 fine + costs
DNA + costs

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Return date scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Return date on June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gene A. Elgersma in court. Discussion held. Court instructs to apply w/SPD; sets Review.
Review hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing on April 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:52 AM Defendant, Gene A. Elgersma in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
